newsitem.title: LEBANON: Beirut Secondary Market will not close - minister.
newsitem.headline: Beirut Secondary Market will not close - minister.

text.p: The privately-operated Beirut Secondary Market which trades only SOLIDERE shares will not close when the company moves over to the Beirut Stock Exchange on Monday, acting finance minister Fouad Siniora said on Wednesday.

"The Beirut Secondary Market is a legal market. It will continue by specialising in some debt related instruments like convertible bonds," Siniora told reporters at the signing of a cross-listing agreement between the Beirut, Kuwait and Cairo stock exchanges.

The BSM was established in 1994 under the auspices of the Bank of Lebanon to trade SOLIDERE A and B shares in the absence of the Beirut Stock Exchange (BSE) which only reopened last January after a 13-year gap.
A BSM official said in June that cement company Sibline would list its seven-year, 12 percent bonds on the BSM, but that they were still under preparation.
